heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The nearest lightning strike ever noted was on 13 May 2025, at 4.97 miles distance.

storm.status: The last storm was on 16 September 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (199°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 2.1°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 152 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1250 m) and light levels (up 8706 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 152.0m lower than yesterday, 639.5m lower than the past week, 1250.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 689m to a maximum of 1098m, averaging 717.2m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1356.7m and 1967.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, the air will be thick and uncomfortable and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, fog or low cloud is expected, and a mix of sun and clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
